messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]unschooling days was good description/what have I missed?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, I m pretty much just a lurker here though some of you may know me from other lists. I have a blog ( see link in my sig line) that is pretty much about
messages.messageBody:
Hi all,
I'm pretty much just a lurker here though some of you may know me from other lists. I have a blog ( see link in my sig line) that is pretty much about our day to day life as unschoolers. I haven't been at it for too long, but there are already some examples of what our days "look" like., and as time goes on there will be more. Your all welcome to check it out.

Trisha
http://radiacalmama.motime.com/

"There is no single effort more radical in it's potential for saving the world than a transformation of the way we raise our children."
_Marianne Williamson


----- Original Message -----
From: SandraDodd@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, October 10, 2003 2:05 PM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] good description/what have I missed?



In a message dated 10/10/03 7:02:09 AM, jparmer@... writes:

<< I was interested in what others' unschooling days looked like and for some
creative unschooling ideas. I wonder if it will get to that?? >>

Some good days are collected here:

http://sandradodd.com/typical

Creative unschooling ideas are easier to come by yourself after you see what
other families are doing, so I think that page would help.

Also here:

http://sandradodd.com/articles

Go especially to
Disposable Dhecklists
Deschooling
Your House as a Museum
Leaning on a Truck

www.unschooling.com message boards has lots of idea-discussions.

Sandra
